articles.title: Bolivia's new government to allow companies like Starlink to operate in the country
articles.description: Bolivia’s new government has issued a decree that will allow global satellite internet companies such as Starlink or Kuiper to provide internet access across the Andean nation as it tries to upgrade its technology and speed up its notoriously slow connectivity rates.
articles.content: LA PAZ, Bolivia (AP) — Bolivia’s new government on Tuesday issued a decree that will allow global satellite internet companies such as Starlink or Kuiper to provide internet access across the Andean nation as it tries to upgrade its technology and sp... [2402 chars]

articles.title: Dr S C Gulhane Prerna College organises intercollegiate event
articles.description: dr s c gulhane prerna college of commerce, science and arts and dr s c gulhane prerna college of management & technology, nagpur, jointly organised a 2-day intercollegiate programme ‘anandam’ in which various competitions like debate, salad decoration, singing, dance, rangoli were held on december 19 and 20. dr amol deshmukh, managing director nkp salve institute of science & lata mangeshkar hospital, was the chief guest whereas dr s c gulhane, secretary, prerna sewa mandal, chaired the function.
articles.content:
Business Reporter :
Dr S C Gulhane Prerna College of Commerce, Science and Arts and Dr S C Gulhane Prerna College of Management & Technology, Nagpur, jointly organised a 2-day intercollegiate programme ‘Anandam’ in which various competitions like deb... [827 chars]

articles.title: EY, Deloitte, PwC, KPMG lock horns with tech companies in age of AI
articles.description: India's top consulting firms, including EY, Deloitte, PwC, and KPMG, are fiercely competing with tech giants like Accenture and Capgemini, alongside Indian IT players. This intense rivalry stems from a surge in companies adopting AI across their operations, propelling technology consulting revenue for the Big Four to an estimated $2.5 billion in India by FY26.
articles.content:
Synopsis
India's top consulting firms, including EY, Deloitte, PwC, and KPMG, are fiercely competing with tech giants like Accenture and Capgemini, alongside Indian IT players. This intense rivalry stems from a surge in companies adopting AI across t... [4703 chars]

articles.title: US judge blocks Texas app store age law meant to protect children
articles.description: WASHINGTON, Dec 23 (Reuters) - ‌A federal judge in Texas on Tuesday blocked Texas from enforcing a ‌new state law aimed at protecting children by requiring app stores and ‌developers to verify the age of users, in a win for Apple , Alphabet's Google and other technology companies.
articles.content: WASHINGTON, Dec 23 (Reuters) - ‌A federal judge in Texas on Tuesday blocked Texas from enforcing a ‌new state law aimed at protecting children by requiring app stores and ‌developers to verify the age of users, in a win for Apple , Alphabet's Google ... [1987 chars]

articles.title: Tech Up as AI Bubble Fears Subside -- Tech Roundup
articles.description:
Shares of technology companies rose as fears about an artificial-intelligence bubble subsided.
One strategist said the AI era would be remembered as another instance of creative destruction, a...
articles.content:
Shares of technology companies rose as fears about an artificial-intelligence bubble subsided.
One strategist said the AI era would be remembered as another instance of "creative destruction," a disruptive phase in the development of technology and t... [814 chars]

articles.title: on training at Nakodar innovative bootcamp
articles.description: A three-day Innovation, Design and Entrepreneurship (IDE) Bootcamp for Principals and teachers of PM SHRI Schools is underway at Satyam Institute of Management & Technology, Nakodar. The camp started on Monday with a participation of over 190 principals and teachers.
articles.content: A three-day Innovation, Design and Entrepreneurship (IDE) Bootcamp for Principals and teachers of PM SHRI Schools is underway at Satyam Institute of Management & Technology, Nakodar. The camp started on Monday with a participation of over 190 princip... [1722 chars]

articles.title: Samsung Electronics unit Harman to acquire ZF Group's ADAS business for $1.8 billion
articles.description: SEOUL, Dec 23 (Reuters) - Samsung ‌Electronics announced on Tuesday a $1.8 billion deal to acquire Germany's ZF Friedrichshafen's autonomous driving ‌technology unit to combine it with its audio business and offer next-generation in-car platforms.
articles.content:
SEOUL, Dec 23 (Reuters) - Samsung ‌Electronics announced on Tuesday a $1.8 billion deal to acquire Germany's ZF Friedrichshafen's autonomous driving ‌technology unit to combine it with its audio business and offer next-generation in-car platforms.
Sa... [2432 chars]
